basics.name: Davide Paolino
basics.label: M.Sc. Physics of Complex Systems
basics.summary: Master's student in Physics of Complex Systems with a focus on statistical physics, computational methods, and stochastic processes. My primary research interests lie in the applications of statistical physics to glassy systems, machine learning, and neuroscience. I am currently working with Professor Ludovic Berthier for my internship. I am passionate about teaching, coding, and sports.

education.institution: Politecnico di Torino, SISSA/ICTP, Université Paris Cité

research.summary: Developing methods to infer particle interactions from experimental data, with applications in equilibrium and non-equilibrium physics, including active matter and disordered systems.
Simulated the 2D Ising model to study phase transitions using Monte Carlo techniques.

work.name: Politecnico di Torino
work.summary: Assisted first-year students with Mathematical Analysis I and Physics I through frontal exercise sessions, improving communication and mentoring skills. Teaching is a core passion of mine, and this role has been instrumental in developing my ability to explain complex concepts clearly and effectively.
highlights: Developed problem-solving strategies for introductory physics
Refined pedagogical skills through hands-on teaching

volunteer.summary: Engaged in community service, developing teamwork, leadership, and problem-solving skills.

projects.name: Monte Carlo Simulation of 2D Ising Model
projects.summary: Studied phase transitions using Monte Carlo techniques in statistical physics.
